metadata.Title: CVE-2021-21708 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: In PHP versions 7.4.x below 7.4.28, 8.0.x below 8.0.16, and 8.1.x below 8.1.3, when using filter functions with FILTER_VALIDATE_FLOAT filter and min/max limits, if the filter fails, there is a possibility to trigger use of allocated memory after free, which can result it crashes, and potentially in overwrite of other memory chunks and RCE. This issue affects: code that uses FILTER_VALIDATE_FLOAT with min/max limits.

notes.Note: sbeattie> PEAR issues should go against php-pear as of xenial rodrigo-zaiden> the issue was introduced in PHP 7.4, seems like it was in commit https://github.com/php/php-src/commit/07df6594

criterions.comment: php7.0: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
